title: 115+ Hysterical Fairy Comments for TikTok & Instagram

steps.title: Leave a comment that cuts deep for the ultimate mic drop moment.
steps.content: Leave a comment that cuts deep for the ultimate mic drop moment. Sometimes, you get a chance to roast someone thatâ€™s too good to pass up! If someone is making a total fool of themselves, acting super cocky, or sharing a deeply unpopular (or straight up rude) opinion, leave one of these to humble them with humor. The more vicious the joke, though, the higher the chance that your comment gets reported for bullying or harassmentâ€”remember that the goal of a fairy comment is to be creatively and humorously offensive, and not to cause real harm or distress. steps.title: A fairy comment is a one-liner that begins innocently but takes a mean twist.
steps.content: A fairy comment is a one-liner that begins innocently but takes a mean twist. The comments are usually left on video posts on TikTok and Instagram to jokingly troll other creators (AKA, deliberately annoy them) and make them feel insecure, as well as to get engagement from other users in the comments section. The comments also an opportunity for people to get creative and make jokes that skirt around a platformâ€™s community guidelines without directly violating them. [2] X Research source Most fairy comments are left on videos where the creator has a â€œbad takeâ€ (ranging from unpopular but innocent opinions to truly offensive or derogatory speech) or where the creator earnestly thinks theyâ€™ve really done something special or unique, but others think itâ€™s poorly done or not very impressive. For example, if a creator is showing off their lackluster â€œoutfit of the day,â€ a commenter might say â€œYouâ€™re showing off the goods ğŸ‘‘ğŸŒ¸ and it burns our eyes ğŸ§šâ€â™‚ï¸ğŸŒ¿.â€

steps.title: Most fairy comments follow the same structure.
steps.content: Most fairy comments follow the same structure. The first part of the comment (the setup) is a supportive or complimentary phrase (for example, â€œYou go girl!â€) to misdirect the reader into thinking the comment is positive. The second part is a surprise punchline that catches the reader off guard and is usually mean and witty (for example, â€œNo really, go away!â€). A short sequence of cute and innocent emojis goes in the middle of the comment to break up the setup and punchline. This gives the comment lots of visual appeal (great for getting attention in a crowded comments section) and naturally makes the reader pause for a split second before reading the punchline. [3] X Research source Most fairy comments also end with a short string of emojis after the punchline to keep up the faux positivity. All together, you get something like â€œYou go girl ğŸ’…ğŸ§šğŸ’ no really, go away ğŸ‘‹â˜€ï¸ğŸŒ¸â€ Fairy comments are considered a unique part of Gen Z humor because of how closely related they are to social media platforms like Instagram or TikTok. Fairy comments wouldnâ€™t exist without those apps!

steps.title: To gently make fun of their friends
steps.content: To gently make fun of their friends Fairy comments are meant to get laughs from other commenters, but sometimes, the creator gets a chuckle too! Fairy commenting on a friendâ€™s post is the safest way to get creative with comedic insults without the fear of getting reported or hurting the creatorâ€™s feelings. Example: If someone is showing off their outfit of the day and their friend wants to playfully make a joke at them, they might comment â€œYouâ€™re serving âœ¨ğŸ’•ğŸ”®ğŸ’ğŸ˜™ ğŸ§œğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸guess weâ€™re starving ğŸ§šğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ’‹ğŸŒˆğŸ’«â€

steps.title: When someone posts a bad take or opinion that others dislike
steps.content: When someone posts a bad take or opinion that others dislike When someone shares a polarizing opinion or makes a truly offensive remark (along the lines of the -isms and -phobias that plague our society), people might share a fairy comment to make a lighthearted dig at them. The comment alone may not get to them, but fairy comments tend to get a lot of attention from other people who see the postâ€”this can change the mood of the entire comments section! Example: If someone posts a video where they say pineapple doesnâ€™t belong on pizza when you believe it does, someone could comment â€œYouâ€™re bold for having confidenceğŸ§šâ£ï¸ğŸ’ next time donâ€™tâœ¨ğŸŒ¼â€

steps.title: When someone thinks they did something well, but really didnâ€™t
steps.content: When someone thinks they did something well, but really didnâ€™t This scenario is a lot more lighthearted than when someoneâ€™s posting offensive opinions. When someone is really confident in their abilities or choices but the end result is questionable (for example, learning some music video choreo but performing it horribly), someone might leave a fairy comment to jokingly rib the person. Itâ€™ll seem like a friendly joke if they know the person, but has the potential to hurt feelings if they and the creator are strangers. Example: If someone posts about how delicious their home cooked dinner is but the video makes the meal look gray and horrible, someone might say â€œlove your hidden talent âœ¨ğŸŒ¸ğŸ‘‘ maybe keep it hidden ğŸ¥°ğŸ§šâ€â™€ï¸ğŸ¤©â€

steps.title: When the comments section is going off
steps.content: When the comments section is going off Fairy comments are great for engagement, but they wonâ€™t get much traction if the post has few views and a bare comments section. People usually choose posts with lots of comments already for the best shot at getting some likes and replies. In super popular videos, the original creator might not even see the comment anyhowâ€”in a way, fairy comments are just as much for other commenters as they are for the creator!

steps.title: Choose an innocent or supportive phrase to be your setup.
steps.content: Choose an innocent or supportive phrase to be your setup. This is the easy part. Pick a generic compliment (like â€œYour confidence is inspiringâ€), some words of wisdom (like â€œPeople say you can do anything if you tryâ€), or an observation from the post (like â€œThis comments section is meanâ€). A lot of fairy comments start with recognizable phrases or expressions to further mislead the reader.

steps.title: Brainstorm a witty and mean twist ending for the punchline.
steps.content: Brainstorm a witty and mean twist ending for the punchline. Hereâ€™s where the creativity comes in. Think about where your setup wants to go (how would you normally expect this comment to end?) and swap in something completely unexpected and a little bit rude. The surprise of the punchline is what makes fairy comments so stinging and funny! For example: â€œYour confidence is inspiringâ€¦me to leave.â€ â€œPeople say you can do anything if you tryâ€¦but they werenâ€™t talking about you.â€ â€œThis comments section is meanâ€¦and I can see why.â€

steps.title: Stuff bright and cute emojis between the setup and after the punchline.
steps.content: Stuff bright and cute emojis between the setup and after the punchline. The last element of a fairy comment is the emojis! There doesnâ€™t have to be a rhyme or reason to the emojis you chooseâ€“-you can pick anything bright, colorful, cute, innocent, or â€œfairyâ€-looking. â€œYour confidence is inspiring âœ¨ğŸ’– me to leave ğŸŒ³ğŸ’ğŸ§šâ€ â€œPeople say you can do anything if you try ğŸ’—ğŸŒŸ but they werenâ€™t talking about you ğŸ’…â˜€ï¸â€ â€œThis comments section is mean ğŸ‘ğŸ˜€ and I can see why ğŸŒ»ğŸ§šğŸ«¶â€ Struggling to come up with an original fairy comment? Try using a fairy comment generator when youâ€™re stuck!

steps.title: Fairy comments gained popularity in 2020 on Instagram.
steps.content: Fairy comments gained popularity in 2020 on Instagram. Itâ€™s not totally known why, but it may be because many people were forced to stay at home during the COVID-19 pandemic and looking for new ways to communicate and express themselves online. [4] X Research source TikTok had come out just a few years earlier in 2016, and Instagram introduced reels (a video feature similar to how TikTok) in 2020. [5] X Research source The combination of new social media video platforms and less in-person interaction set the stage for fairy comments to be born. The term â€œfairy commentsâ€ may come from the aesthetically cute and whimsical emojis (like the fairy ğŸ§š emoji itself) that define what a fairy comment looks like. It might also allude to how the original versions of many classic fairy tales begin innocently and take a dark twist at the end.
